<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Gear Gnash](/Feats.aspx?ID=3135) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 54</row>

**Archetype** [Trapsmith](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=111)

**Prerequisites**
[Trapsmith Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3134); Expert in [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)

</column>

---

[Snares](/equipment/snares) you create have complicated inner workings that are quite difficult to disable. Creatures attempting to [Disable](/Actions.aspx?ID=69) your snares that use gears must succeed at an additional [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) check in order to disable the snare. On a failed check, while the snare doesn't fully trigger, the grinding mechanisms deal bludgeoning damage to the creature equal to half your level. The snare still triggers on a critical failure, as normal.
name: Gear Gnash
